ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR POLI/SCI INRL STUDENTS BROAD AND IN DEPTH INTRO TO NATIONALISM

I would highly recommend this course to students. The reading load, while heavy, is fascinating. The instructor is very committed to the substance of the course and to helping students with their papers.
A solid, general introduction to the nationalism literature and amore specific look into nationalism in the post-Soviet states.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: In addition to its thematic and substantive depth, the course also debates ontological and methodological issues in social science. The empirical focus in the latter half of the course is immensely helpful for thinking about research strategies for dissertation writing.

This was my first exposure to the topic of nationalism. I found it highly relevant to a couple different projects that I'm working on (and that seemed, at the outset, totally unrelated), and I'm hoping to pursue my paper for the course in future semesters.
